aspect: - An Oregon couple announced their pregnancy in a rap video set to the theme song of '90s television sitcom 'The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air.'
- The couple, Jesse and Melissa Meek, made the video so loved ones could know about the baby.
- The video, which has been viewed over 1.7 million times on YouTube, features the couple rapping about their life and the pregnancy news.
- The original song details how the show's character Will Smith grew up in West Philadelphia, and the Meeks' parody video includes similar lyrics about their life in Happy Valley, Oregon.
- The couple thought it would take longer than the two months it took for them to conceive.
- At the end of the video, the Meeks share a sonogram of their unborn child.
- The video was made so loved ones living far away could know about the baby.
- The couple's great-great-grandfather was Oregon pioneer Joseph Lafayette Meek.
- The video includes the couple's dog, and the pregnancy news was revealed after Jesse read a tag on the dog.
- A Phoenixville, Pennsylvania, couple made a pregnancy announcement video using the same theme song last year.
explain: The couples rapped in a video shared on YouTube to reveal they were pregnant and had bought their first home.
The aspect states that the video was made by Jesse and Melissa Meek so that their loved ones could learn about the arrival of their baby.
The video has been viewed over 1.7 million times on YouTube and features the couple rapping about their life and the pregnancy news.

The core idea of the aspect is that the parody video that the Meeks made, which features them rapping while driving in a car, has been viewed over 1.7 million times on YouTube. The video is a take on the song "He's The DJ, I'm The Rapper," which originally features the character Will Smith rapping about his life growing up in West Philadelphia. The Meeks' version of the song includes similar lyrics about their life in Happy Valley, Oregon, where they bought their first house and started building their homestead.
The couple was surprised that they were able to conceive within two months, as they had thought it would take longer.

The aspect mentions that at the end of the video, the Meeks share a sonogram of their unborn child. This is important as it reveals a personal and emotional moment for the couple, showcasing their joy and excitement for their new addition to the family. It also gives viewers a glimpse into their personal life and future plans, adding another layer of emotional connection.
The core idea of the aspect is that the Meeks created the video to keep their relatives and friends updated about their baby's arrival, as they live far away.

According to the given aspect, the great-great-grandfather of the couple was Oregon pioneer Joseph Lafayette Meek. This means that they come from a long line of people who were involved in the early settlement and development of the state of Oregon.
The aspect highlights that the pregnancy news was revealed after Jesse read a tag on the couple's pet dog in the car, which is a lighthearted and unexpected way to share such a big life change.
The aspect informs that a pregnancy announcement video, using the same theme song as referenced, was created by a Phoenixville, Pennsylvania couple last year.
